Reaper: Westonmach's Reaper Auto Cannons are known for their light weight, massive damage, long range, and being compact in size.
Their projectiles have penetrating tips and explosive warheads, and deal a massive knock-down punch as well as armor and structure damage.
Their warheads also deal heat damage.
Heavier models have an increased chance of inflicting critical hits.
Reaper ACs and their ammunition are both constructed from metal alloys with custom-engineered atomic structure designed by Westonmach,
making them very strong while being very lightweight and compact.
Their ammunition, aside from their warheads, are solid custom alloy rounds with no explosives or propellants,
so how fast and far the projectiles fly depends on the gun that shoots them, not the ammunition.
Light, Medium, and Heavy models use focused kinetic projection technology to fly their projectiles towards close and medium-ranged targets,
with Heavy models built to shoot targets at closer range but with larger projectiles that do more damage and greater stability knockdown effect.
Ultra models offer only one or a few shots of very large, "killer" rounds that can take out almost anything before running out of ammunition.
Sniper models are designed for very long range attack.
"BF" or "Burst Fire" models shoot bursts of five rounds per attack.
Medium, Heavy, and Ultra models will partially stun a target on a successful hit for one to a few rounds,
causing the target to have reduced mobility in the form of reduced walking, running, and jumping distance.
These weapons come in different models (Light, Medium, Heavy, Ultra, Sniper, etc.) as well as multiple "type" levels (Type 1, Type 2, etc.).
Weapons of a higher type have increased damage and range, but also weaken the structural integrity of a battlemech's armor as a trade-off.

Deathfire: Deathfire Rockets are heavy-hitting, long-range rockets with explosive warheads that function much like LRMs.
They can be used for indirect fire with the help of a spotter.
Small and compact compared to SRM and LRM missiles, they don't take up a lot of space,
and are made out of high-tech materials that make them lightweight.
These weapons come in different "levels" (1 to 10), which determine how large the launchers are, how many rockets they fire in an attack,
and how much space they use up intalled in a battlemech,  and also different "type" levels (Type 1, Type 2, etc.).
Versions of weapons of a higher type have increased damage, range, and sometimes accuracy,
but also weaken the structural integrity of a battlemech's armor as a trade-off.

Enforcer: Westonmach Ultra-Kinetic Machine Guns shoot lightweight but hard-hitting rounds that are made out of shaped,
metal alloy materials with a custom-engineered atomic structure, designed and patented by Westonmach corporation.
Their ammunition doesn't contain or use any gunpowder, chemicals, or explosives,
and as such can be struck, damaged, and set on fire without any risk of exploding.
The guns that fire them, not the ammunition, accelerate the rounds,
and so the speed and range of the fired rounds depend on the gun that shoots them and not the ammunition.
Westonmach Enforcer Machine Guns are designed to shoot rounds for a considerable distance,
and rival short and medium range lasers and other battlemech-mounted weaponry,
while at the same time functioning as support weapons that fire during battlemech melee combat.
UK (Ultra-Kinetic) Machine Guns have an increased chance of inflicting critical hits when hitting a target.
These weapons come in different "type" levels (Type 1, Type 2, etc.).
Versions of weapons of a higher type have increased damage, range, and sometimes accuracy,
but also weaken the structural integrity of a battlemech's armor as a trade-off.
MF_Laser: Westonmach Multi-Frequency Battlemech lasers are super-intense laser weapons that shoot a laser beam containing
multiple lasers of different frequencies at the same time, integrated into one beam of energy.  They do a serious amount
of damage to their targets, and also heat up the target when they hit.  Like regular battlemech-mounted lasers, they enjoy
an accuracy bonus, and don't require any ammunition.  The small versions are support weapons that fire during melee.
Westonmach Multi-Frequency lasers will temporarily impair a target's ability to cool itself, overheating the target on a successful hit.
A target hit by one of these lasers will have a lower maximum heat threshold for a few turns, as well as a lower threshold for shutting down.
In addition, while a target that has been hit is cooling off, the damaged area is melting and hot, and for a short time won't protect the target
as much from further damage, making other damage temporarily reduce armor and structure a little more than it normally would.
These weapons come in different "type" levels (Type 1, Type 2, etc.).
Versions of weapons of a higher type have increased damage, range, and sometimes accuracy,
but also weaken the structural integrity of a battlemech's armor as a trade-off.
